intro: Galium rothrockii, commonly known as Rothrock's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and wetlands. Galium rothrockii is often found in areas with rich, organic soil and is an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
